@qqu0127 - wow.. have you become a committer? Congrats first !!! THANKS !!!!

PR approved by @xyuanlu 
Commit message:
Implementation of LockClient for Lattice.

This test case has been fixed by change: https://github.com/apache/helix/pulls?q=is%3Apr+is%3Aclosed+author%3Adesaikomal

can we please mark this as closed?
this test has been fixed since checkin : https://github.com/apache/helix/pull/2442
we havent seen this failure for a year. can we please close this?
this test failure we haven't seen for over last 6 month. also this file was deleted as part of the other change and so this issue can be closed. thanks

> Thanks Naman for fixing the bug. Wrt - reset() and disconnect() happening in parallel and reset() takes precedence over disconnect() seems wrong to me. Will you have another issue created to track the above race?

Yes. I will create another issue for this one.

This PR is ready to be merged. Approved by @qqu0127  // Thanks
Commit message: Change pom of metaclient pom file

> > Could you please check if this tests passed in 20 runs in your local repo?
> 
> Could you please add the link the CI executions of your personal repo as a reference? Thanks!

Sure, here's the link with the tests: https://github.com/limbooverlambda/helix/pull/3

Thanks for updating the test runs! 
Could you please double check this run? It was #7 in the last batch of 20 runs..
![Screenshot 2023-05-22 at 10 12 35 AM](https://github.com/apache/helix/assets/6392021/4bdcd19b-37c0-49d8-8565-d9bbb57ce971)
This test fails in: https://github.com/apache/helix/actions/runs/5048211978

> Thanks for working on this! Detailed analysis! LGTM. Could you please run the whole CI suite 20 times and update the link? Thanks!

I ran the `PR_CI` workflow 20 times and the results can be found over [here](https://github.com/parakhnr/helix/actions?query=branch%3Afix-clusterstatusmonitor-test-20). For the tests that failed I didn't saw any failures related to `TestClusterStatusMonitorLifecycle`.

The code has been reviewed and approved by @rahulrane50 and @desaikomal.
Commit message: Fixing the TestClusterStatusMonitorLifecyle integration test.

> Thanks for updating the test runs! Could you please double check this run? It was #7 in the last batch of 20 runs.. ![Screenshot 2023-05-22 at 10 12 35 AM](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6392021/239983132-4bdcd19b-37c0-49d8-8565-d9bbb57ce971.png)

Good catch. I have tweaked the timeout a bit more for the affected path and rerun the tests in my branch: https://github.com/limbooverlambda/helix/pull/4

Let me know if this looks good.

This test fails in: https://github.com/apache/helix/actions/runs/5051329875
Xiaoyuan, there are still pending changes in the branch. I know you have completed the certification testing but wanted to know what happens to all the new / remaining changes?
This test fails in: https://github.com/apache/helix/actions/runs/5051694925
@qqu0127 - i have resolved the comments. can i please get your review? thanks
We have confirmed that by override the getExecutorService() method in StateModelFactory will resolve this issue. Please close this issue as FIXED once you are satisfied with the requet.

This PR is ready to be merged. Thanks @xyuanlu for reviewing and approving the request.
Commit message: Change CallbackHandler messages for debuggability.
@limbooverlambda  Thanks for making the change. Please update final commit message.

> @limbooverlambda Thanks for making the change. Please update final commit message.

+1

Thanks for follow up with comment. Normally commit message format is 
```
The code has been reviewed and approved by @reviewer_1
Commit message: xxx
```
example: https://github.com/apache/helix/pull/2489

I will use the PR title this time. Please follow open source format for next PR. :D

This PR is ready to be merged. Approved by @desaikomal // Thanks

If possible, can you please close the issue if not reproducible. thanks,
komal

Please help us review this and WAGED change. Please.

Commit message:  Update HttpClient version across all 3 components of Helix.
Still broken two and a half years later.

Thanks @qqu0127 and @parakhnr for review. This change has been approved by @parakhnr and @qqu0127. Ready to be merged.

@qqu0127 - is this bug still valid? AFAIK we verified that we are doing the required. There may be additional change on the participant side may be required but there is no action on helix side.

@rahulrane50  - is this bug still relevant?
if not, can you please close it.

thanks,
Komal
Quincy, i am tracking all the bugs going forward and so can we close this one, please?

Commit message: In WAGED, during N, N+1, we may not satisfy the HARD constraint resulting in failure. This is part-1 of the change where we start keeping track of instance capacity with pending messages.

OK, I won't notify you again about this release, but will get in touch when a new version is available. If you'd rather skip all updates until the next major or minor version, let me know by commenting `@dependabot ignore this major version` or `@dependabot ignore this minor version`.

If you change your mind, just re-open this PR and I'll resolve any conflicts on it.
